alert.note: Alert for Eastern Mogollon Rim; Little Colorado River Valley in Coconino County; Little Colorado River Valley in Navajo County; Western Mogollon Rim (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 23 at 12:31PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT AREAS NORTHEAST OF CLINTS` WELL AND NEAR/WEST OF THE GUZZLER FIRE THROUGH 100 PM MST... At 1228 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a cluster of strong thunderstorms 9 miles northeast of Starlight Pines moving west at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph, heavy rain, and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Erratic wind shifts near the Guzzler Fire may take place through 1 PM. Locations impacted include... The Guzzler Fire, Tremaine Lake, Starlight Pines, Chevelon Canyon Dam, Blue Ridge Campground, Long Lake, Rock Crossing Campground, Chevelon Butte, Chevelon Crossing Campground, Chevelon Canyon Lake Campground, and Chavez Mountain. This includes the following highways... State Route 87 between mile markers 293 and 332. State Route 99 between mile markers 23 and 33. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building, especially due to frequent cloud to ground lightning. Remember, lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to minor flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Mogollon Rim; Little Colorado River Valley in Coconino County; Little Colorado River Valley in Navajo County; Western Mogollon Rim
